publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1586 Shiona Baird: Supermarket Developments-That the Parliament notes with concern the growing number of planning applications for supermarket developments which, if approved, will lead to the loss of green spaces, increased car use and the further erosion of local shopping areas, all to the detriment of local communities; recognises the threat posed by large supermarket developments to smaller retailers and the disproportionate impact on elderly and less mobile consumers who rely on local services and supplies, and calls on the Scottish Executive to take action to protect local communities from this threat to their sustainability. Supported by: Mike Pringle*, Mark Ballard*, Robin Harper*
S2M-1586 Supermarket Developments (lodged on 16 July 2004) Chris Ballance*, Patrick Harvie*, Carolyn Leckie*, Frances Curran*
S2M-1586 Supermarket Developments (lodged on 16 July 2004) Rosie Kane*, Eleanor Scott*
S2M-1586 Supermarket Developments (lodged on 16 July 2004) Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-1586 Supermarket Developments (lodged on 16 July 2004) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-1586 Supermarket Developments (lodged on 16 July 2004) Dr Jean Turner*
